articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas urged the U.N. General Assembly on Thursday to stop the war in the Gaza Strip between Israel and Palestinian Hamas militants, saying Israel had almost entirely destroyed Gaza and it was no longer fit for life.
articles.title: Palestinian President Abbas urges UN to stop the war in Gaza

articles.author: Steve Holland, Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: The aid includes the first shipment of a precision-guided glide bomb called the Joint Standoff Weapon, with a range of up to 81 miles, giving Ukraine a major upgrade.
articles.title: Biden announces $8 billion in military aid for Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States, France and several allies called for an immediate 21-day ceasefire following intense discussions at the United Nations.
articles.title: Lebanese prime minister believes ceasefire between Israel and Hezbollah possible

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Egyptian and international civil society groups on Thursday called for the release of the country's most prominent activist, Alaa Abd el-Fattah, after his lawyer indicated that he would remain in detention until 2027.
articles.title: Civil society groups call for release of top Egyptian activist

articles.author: Rich McKay, Brendan O'Brien, Andrew Hay
articles.description: Florida braced for the arrival of Hurricane Helene on Thursday, forecast to be a powerful Category 4 storm when it smashes into the state's panhandle.
articles.title: Hurricane Helene barrels toward Florida with fierce winds, storm surge

articles.author: Catarina Demony
articles.description: Britain’s wrongful detention and deportation of Caribbean migrants was the result of decades of racist immigration laws designed to reduce the country’s non-white population, a long-withheld official report showed on Thursday.
articles.title: Britain's racist immigration laws led to wrongful deportations of Black people, report says

articles.author: Luc Cohen, Bing Guan
articles.description: Federal agents searched New York City Mayor Eric Adams' residence on Thursday morning, after he was indicted on criminal charges following a long-running investigation that has sent the largest U.S. city's government into turmoil.
articles.title: New York Mayor Adams' residence searched after criminal charges filed

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Federal Emergency Management Agency Administrator Deanne Criswell on Thursday urged Americans in the path of Hurricane Helene not to underestimate the storm's impact, hours before it was expected to make landfall in Florida.
articles.title: FEMA administrator says Americans should heed Hurricane Helene warnings

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British police called on Thursday for anyone with allegations against former Harrods owner Mohamed Al Fayed to come forward and said it would look to prosecute others after multiple women accused the late billionaire of sexual abuse and rape.
articles.title: UK police will investigate others over ex-Harrods boss assault allegations

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Hong Kong judge on Thursday sentenced to jail two former editors who had been earlier found guilty of sedition in a landmark case that sparked an international outcry.
articles.title: Hong Kong court sentences two editors to jail in landmark sedition case
